text: So this is the SBS Question Segment, huh?

We all know that the naming pattern of the Marine admirals is a color plus an animal. I'm imagining that there must be some kind of deliberating body within the Marines that determines the admiral names. Could the man in charge of this body actually be the legendary Vice Admiral Namingheim? I mean, it has to be, right?!
Y...yes!! How did you know about him?
There are other Marines who have nicknames like that, not just the admirals, but they're all named by him!!
Is that Izo?! The 16th division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates was formerly one of the Nine Red Scabbards? Whoa... Was Kozuki Oden the former 16th division commander?!

Whoa... That's a very small detail you've picked up on. That's the flashback scene where young Kin'emon and cohorts get captured. There certainly are nine of them present, but what should be Okiku looks a bit different? Izo, by the way, is one of the Whitebeard division captains who showed up in the Battle of Marineford. He wears traditional Japanese clothing, and does resemble that character. Also, there's that note in Volume 82, Chapter 820, that a
number of Wano people were on Whitebeard's ship too. All of this will be made clearer in time, so just sit back and read. You'll figure it out!
Okay, so... Oden, Dog and Cat were on Whitebeard's ship, then...
